poem:
**House of Guinness**

In sepia-tinted Dublin, where steam  
meets stout, a dynasty unfolds,  
like clockwork intentions, brewing  
in copper shadows—critics' frowns  
rise like foam. A pint of history, served  
with gears and grit, toasts to another  
American dream; while Irish echoes grumble  
in alleyways, among cobblestones  
and whispered tales.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘A steampunk Mr Tayto’: why Irish critics hate Netflix’s House of Guinness The new Netflix show House of Guinness appears to have everything: a top-notch cast, sumptuous cinematography and a story billed as a cross between Succession and Peaky Blinders, a combination that has made the drama a ratings hit and garnered rave reviews. American and British critics have lauded the tale of the brewing dynasty as a stylish and entertaining romp through 1860s Dublin.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘A steampunk Mr Tayto’: why Irish critics hate Netflix’s House of Guinness The new Netflix show House of Guinness appears to have everything: a top-notch cast, sumptuous cinematography and a story billed as a cross between Succession and Peaky Blinders, a combination that has made the drama a ratings hit and garnered rave reviews. American and British critics have lauded the tale of the brewing dynasty as a stylish and entertaining romp through 1860s Dublin.
